blogs.title: Node.js
blogs.description: Node.js is a JavaScript runtime built on Chrome's V8 engine, used to build scalable and high-performance server-side applications.

blogs.title: Express.js
blogs.description: Express.js is a lightweight and flexible web framework for Node.js, ideal for building APIs and backend services.

blogs.title: MongoDB
blogs.description: MongoDB is a document-based NoSQL database that allows for flexible and scalable storage of structured and unstructured data.

blogs.title: PostgreSQL
blogs.description: PostgreSQL is a powerful, open-source relational database known for its reliability, robustness, and advanced features.

blogs.title: TypeScript
blogs.description: TypeScript enhances JavaScript with strong typing, making backend codebases easier to manage and less error-prone.

blogs.title: NestJS
blogs.description: NestJS is a progressive Node.js framework for building efficient, scalable, and maintainable server-side applications using TypeScript.

blogs.title: Redis
blogs.description: Redis is an in-memory key-value data store commonly used for caching, real-time analytics, and session management.

blogs.title: Docker
blogs.description: Docker is a platform that enables developers to package applications and dependencies into containers for reliable deployment.
